devenb123:

put it in eclipse bro

Telling people to copy your code, put it in an IDE that they may/not have, and expecting them to fix it for you is probably the most arrogant thing I have heard.

item.title: Code
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“devenb123, post:1, topic:424961”]i basically need to know how to fix this. i added it 100% by myself in order to give something GOOD to the community
YES IM USING ECLIPSE

[code]package org.dementhium.content.skills;

import org.dementhium.model.player.Skills;
import org.dementhium.model.Item;
import org.dementhium.model.player.Player;

/**
*

  • @author 'Deven monkeypants3@yahoo.com

  • @author Steve golden_32@live.com

  • @author Lumby lumbyjr@hotmail.com

  • @author Emperor black_dragon_686@hotmail.com
    */
    public class Skillrewards {

     public static int Skillrewards(Player player) {
         int count = 0;
         for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) {
                 if (player.getSkills().getLevelForExperience(i) >= 99) {
                         count++;
                 }
         }
         return count;
         }
 }

public enum rewards {
Attackreward(Skills.ATTACK, new Item[] {new Item(995, 10000), 99}),
Farmingreward(Skills.FARMING, new Item[]{new Item(995, 10000), 99});

/**

  • The Skill associated
    /
    private int skillId;
    /    *
  • The reward items
    /
    private Item[] rewards;
    /    *

*/
private int skillLevel;

public int getskillId(){
return skillId;
}

public Item getrewards(){
return rewards;
}

public int getskillLevel(){
return skillLevel;
}

private rewards(int npcId, int skillId, Item[] rewards, skillLevel)
this.skillId = skillId;
this.Item[] rewards = rewards;
this.skillLevel = skillLevel;
}

[/code][/quote]

So wait… What are you trying to do exactly?

Read full topic

item.description:
@devenb123 wrote:

i basically need to know how to fix this. i added it 100% by myself in order to give something GOOD to the community
YES IM USING ECLIPSE

[code]package org.dementhium.content.skills;

import org.dementhium.model.player.Skills;
import org.dementhium.model.Item;
import org.dementhium.model.player.Player;

/**
*

  • @author 'Deven monkeypants3@yahoo.com

  • @author Steve golden_32@live.com

  • @author Lumby lumbyjr@hotmail.com

  • @author Emperor black_dragon_686@hotmail.com
    */
    public class Skillrewards {

     public static int Skillrewards(Player player) {
         int count = 0;
         for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) {
                 if (player.getSkills().getLevelForExperience(i) >= 99) {
                         count++;
                 }
         }
         return count;
         }
 }

public enum rewards {
Attackreward(Skills.ATTACK, new Item[] {new Item(995, 10000), 99}),
Farmingreward(Skills.FARMING, new Item[]{new Item(995, 10000), 99});

/**

  • The Skill associated
    /
    private int skillId;
    /    *
  • The reward items
    /
    private Item[] rewards;
    /    *

*/
private int skillLevel;

public int getskillId(){
return skillId;
}

public Item getrewards(){
return rewards;
}

public int getskillLevel(){
return skillLevel;
}

private rewards(int npcId, int skillId, Item[] rewards, skillLevel)
this.skillId = skillId;
this.Item[] rewards = rewards;
this.skillLevel = skillLevel;
}

[/code]
